item.title: BOE Stress-Test Results Give Domestic Banking Stocks a Breather
item.description: The BOE’s stress test results showed the resilience of the U.K. banking sector and should be good news for Lloyds Banking Group and NatWest, CMC Markets said.

item.title: Euro Boosted by Weak Dollar; Losses After Weak ZEW Prove Temporary
item.description: The euro rose to a two-month high against the dollar as the U.S. currency lost ground ahead of inflation data.

item.title: Oil Hovers at 10-Week High Ahead of US CPI
item.description: Oil prices edged up to their highest levels since late April on signs of emerging tightness, with seaborne crude shipments from Russia declining, suggesting it is finally making good on its promise to cut output.

item.title: Metals Inch Higher Ahead of US CPI
item.description: Metal prices inched higher with the U.S. CPI data key for direction in the immediate term, ING said.

item.title: Rebuilding Trust in Carbon Offsets Faces Uphill Battle
item.description: Around 95% of buyers today don’t meet new standards on carbon offsets.

item.title: Negotiators See Global Deal on Taxing Tech Firms Within Reach
item.description: An agreement would reallocate taxation of about $200 billion in profits; failure could lead some nations to impose their own levies on companies.

item.title: German Schatz Yield Seen Falling in Coming Months
item.description: A long position in two-year German Schatz could be appropriate for investors who believe the ECB has only one more 25 bps interest-rate rise in store, Natixis said, expecting the two-year Schatz yield at 2.9% by the end of September.

item.title: NATO Agrees to Pull Ukraine Closer, but Offers No Membership Timeline
item.description: In failing to offer Ukraine a clear path to joining the alliance, NATO disappoints Kyiv, which viewed the alliance as critical to deterring Russia.

item.title: DNB Beats Views, Backs Outlook
item.description: DNB reported an above-forecast second-quarter profit and net interest income on profitable growth in lending and deposits and higher interest rates, and reiterated its financial targets.

item.title: Thales Expands Avionics with Cobham Aerospace Buy
item.description: Thales has entered into exclusive negotiations to buy France-based Cobham Aerospace Communications for an enterprise value of $1.1 billion and said the acquisition is expected to bring yearly double-digit EBIT growth in the medium term.

item.title: North Korea Launches Suspected Long-Range Missile
item.description: Pyongyang has expressed outrage toward the U.S. in recent days over a variety of issues.

item.title: U.S. Government Emails Hacked in Suspected Chinese Espionage Campaign
item.description: The penetration is being viewed as part of an espionage campaign that potentially compromised valuable information.

item.title: Cluster Munitions Approved for Ukraine: Here's Why They're So Destructive
item.description: The Biden administration said it plans to send cluster munitions to Ukraine to bolster the country’s offensive against Russian forces. WSJ explains the technology behind the weapons and why they’ve raised humanitarian concerns.

item.title: The Things Hotels Still Can't Get Right
item.description: Travelers are paying more for hotels but often getting less, from problems with pools to missing food and drink items on menus, even at high-end lodging.

item.title: London's Canary Wharf Takes Brunt of Real-Estate Pain
item.description: Empty offices, remote working and corporate tenants fleeing to buzzier parts of the U.K. capital are all hitting the 30-year-old business district.

item.title: Masked Gunmen and a Stolen Toilet: How Russia Seized a Ukrainian City's Businesses
item.description: Many of Melitopol’s companies have been taken over by Russian interests. Now some former owners are fighting back.

item.title: Big Automakers Grab $1 Billion Deal for Urgently Needed Battery Metals
item.description: Volkswagen and Jeep maker Stellantis are each committing $100 million in a complicated transaction that will create a publicly traded mining company producing nickel and copper.

item.title: Measure It Differently, and Inflation Is Behind Us
item.description: Gauge U.S. price changes the way Europe does, and inflation was already just below 3% in May.

item.title: Amazon is projecting new heights for this year's Prime Day, while analysts expect concerns about the economy to weigh on consumer demand.
item.description: Amazon is projecting new heights for this year’s Prime Day, while analysts expect concerns about the economy to weigh on consumer demand.

item.title: NATO leaders declined to offer Ukraine a clear timeline or path to join the alliance while affirming plans to extend a future invitation, a level of ambiguity that Zelensky blasted as "unprecedented and absurd" as his country battles Russia.
item.description: NATO leaders declined to offer Ukraine a clear timeline or path to join the alliance while affirming plans to extend a future invitation, a level of ambiguity that Zelensky blasted as “unprecedented and absurd” as his country battles Russia.
